alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 11:02AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Sullivan. * WHEN...From 2 PM EDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An area of showers and thunderstorms is expected to form this afternoon and early evening. Locally heavy rainfall from repeat thunderstorms could result in localized rainfall totals of 3 to 4 inches. If this rain falls within a shorter time window (1 to 2 hours), localized flooding may occur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
